# Understanding ThreatScope Mobile XTM

Last updated January 5, 2026 by Appdome

## Intro

ThreatScope Mobile XTM offers insight into the actual attacks and threats faced by Appdome-protected apps once they’re released into production. The dashboard’s data refreshes every hour, allowing security teams to monitor evolving attacks and swiftly respond to emerging trends in real-time. To ensure that threats faced by a protected app are displayed on the dashboard, there’s no need for prerequisites, API integrations by the Operations teams, or code changes by the mobile development teams.

## Setting up Access to ThreatScope Dashboard

Access to a protected app’s threat data on the ThreatScope Dashboard is gated only to viewer accounts that meet the following conditions:

* The viewer account is licensed to access the ThreatScope Dashboard  
  Submit a request to Appdome support to activate the license for the accounts that should have access to threat data.
* Threat data originates from teams of which the viewer is a member.  
  The team leader of each production team should configure the viewer account. For details, see the section **Configuring the Viewer Account**.
* The viewer has the View ThreatScope entitlement in the team.  
  For more details, see the section **Add View ThreatScope Entitlement** to Members Account below.

### Configuring the Viewer Account

To configure the viewer account, the team leader needs to:

1. Open the User Menu.
2. Click on **Team Management**.  
   ![User Menu Threatscope](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/user-menu-threatscope-307x731.png)
3. Search for the relevant team.
4. Review the team member list.  
   ![View Team Members](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/View-Team-Members.png)  
   If the requested viewer’s account does not appear, invite the viewer by clicking the Invite New Member button.  
   ![Invite New Member](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Invite-New-Member.png)
5. Type the viewer account’s name and hit enter. When done, click **Invite**.  
   ![Invite New Members to Team](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Screenshot-2024-05-22-at-14.02.15.png)
6. After the viewer accepts the invitation, proceed to the next step of adding the required entitlements to the team.

### Add View ThreatScope Entitlement to Members Account

In order to add the **View ThreatScope** entitlement to a member’s account of a production team, the team leader should follow these steps:

1. Click on **Team Management** account in the user menu and click the button to add entitlements.  
   A list of the entitlements available for the account will be displayed.
2. Click the **View ThreatScope** entitlement.  
   ![Viewthreatscopebutton](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/ViewThreatScopeButton-1.png)

## Reviewing the Dashboard Structure

The dashboard allows you to perform the following tasks:

* Select the viewing scope
* Select the date range
* Review the geographical source of threats
* View all attacks
* Use the Performance Stream widget
* Display top 10 defense breakdown
* View Attacks Breakdown
* Filter Missing Intelligence
* Review performance streams

### Selecting the Viewing Scope

The dashboard viewer allows defining the scope of data items (threats) to be displayed from the following options:

* A specific team  
  View only threats associated with apps built by the selected team  
  ![View Threatscope Bar](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/view-threatscope-bar.png)
* All my teams  
  View threats associated with apps built by all teams that the ThreatScope viewer is entitled to access  
  ![View Threatscope Teamsbar](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/view-threatscope-teamsbar.png)
* Personal workspace  
  ![View Threatscope Personalworkspace 0bar](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/view-threatscope-personalworkspace-0bar.png)

### Selecting the Date Range

The Set Date Range section defines the date range of data items (threats) to be displayed. By default, the date range is set to the last 30 days, but this range can be extended in accordance with the ThreatScope dashboard license.

![Threatscope Daterange](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Threatscope-Daterange-650x340.png)

### **Threat Trends**

**Threat Trends** provides valuable insights into the threats your apps are facing, categorized by Appdome’s protection packages.  
Track the evolution of mobile threats over various time frames, including total threats detected, the most attacked app, and the predominant attack methods for each protection package.

[![Threat Trends](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Threat_Trends.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Threat_Trends.png)

**Display Options:**

* You can explore the data in **daily, weekly, or monthly** views.  
  [![Days Weeks Months](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Days_Weeks_Months.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Days_Weeks_Months.png)
* The color-coded protection packages at the bottom of the display allow you to filter the data by clicking on them to include or exclude specific packages.[![Threat Trends Edit Protection Packages](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Threat_Trends_Edit_Protection_Packages.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Threat_Trends_Edit_Protection_Packages.png)

* Hovering over any point in the graph reveals a tooltip with detailed information, including the date or date range, total attacks detected, the top attack method, and the most targeted app.  
  [![Threat Trends Focus Tooltip](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Threat_Trends_Focus_Tooltip.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Threat_Trends_Focus_Tooltip.png)
* **Bot Defense Data –** When selecting this option from the Threat-Inspect™ menu, it adds the MobileBot data to the Threat Trends display.  
  [Click here to learn more about Appdome’s MobileBOT™ Defense.](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/mobile-bot-detection/mobile-bot-defense/mobilebot-detection/)  
  [![Bot Defense Data](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Bot-Defense-Data-2.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Bot-Defense-Data-2.png)[![Threat Trends Mobilebot](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Threat_Trends_MobileBot.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Threat_Trends_MobileBot.png)

### Reviewing the geographical source of threats

The GeoSource section displays a map that allows viewing the country from which the attacks originate.  
Countries are colored based on the volume of threats detected in the region. For clarification, see the legend on the right.

[![Attack Map Threatscope](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Geo_All.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Geo_All.png)

Hover over the requested country to see a breakdown of the information by the following items:

* **Country name**
* **Date Range**  
  Only threats from the listed date range are aggregated.
* **Total attacks**  
  The sum represents all attacks originating from the country over which the mouse hovers.
* **Top 3 Attacks**  
  The top attacks for the selected country  
  [![Attack Map Threatscope tooltip](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Geo_Tooltip.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Geo_Tooltip.png)

**To select one or more countries:**

* To select a single country, click the requested country on the map or choose its corresponding checkbox. To deselect a country, click the checkbox of the already selected country.
* To select multiple countries, check the boxes next to each requested country.
* All other ThreatScope displays will update according to the selected countries.  
  [![Select multiple countries Threatscope](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Geo_Select.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Geo_Select.png)![Country Tab](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/country-tab.png)

**Types of Geography-based data input**

The following types of geography-based data input exist:

* **Non-specific**  
  The default data input on Appdome relies on the public IP address captured from its analytics server to map the threat’s location. Given that attackers can mask their public IP using tools such as VPNs and proxies, this data is labeled as “non-specific,” namely because we cannot always pinpoint the precise source of an attack.

* **Specific**  
  In this case, the data input is the device’s location data (GPS). However, since accessing location data requires declaring specific permission in the app and user consent, this type of threat geo-source is not the default option and requires opting in when building the app on Appdome.

**Note**:  
The app’s developer is responsible for adding the required location permissions and requesting user consent to access the device’s location since Appdome will not add location permissions to the protected app and trigger any access to location data without checking if the user has granted access to their location data.

**What can be inferred from the data**

* **Ability to create a focus list of countries that generate the most attacks**  
  Customers that have a web application firewall (WAF) in place can use this data stream to apply different security policies based on the threat landscape of the app and the app’s user base.
* **Visibility of how the** **threat types are distributed within a given country**This can enable tracking which vectors are used by different local and global actors.
* You can use the [Snapshots](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/advanced-threat-intelligence-android-ios/threatscope-mobile-xdr/threatscope-snapshots/) feature to download the current view of the selected GeoSource.

### Using the Performance Streams widget

The Performance Stream Widget displays the distribution of attacks of the selected date range between the various performance streams.

[![Threat Stream Widget](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Threat_Stream_Widget.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Threat_Stream_Widget.png)

**What can be inferred from the data?**

* **Evaluate the risk level of released apps**By tracking blocked and app-enforced threats.
* **Compare intelligence gathered by released apps**With the actual volume of attacks and threats.

**Filtering the display**

Click on any Performance Stream tile to remove the selected performance stream from the filter. You can adjust the filter to view one or multiple Performance Streams.  
You can also apply filters by using the left-side menu.

When you apply a filter using the Performance Stream widgets, the selected category is highlighted in color, and the unselected categories turn gray. This visual distinction helps you easily identify which filters are active while focusing on the data from the selected category.  
The filter is applied on the Geo Source and the Top 10 Defenses displays.

[![Threatscope1](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/ThreatScope1-1.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/ThreatScope1-1.png)

### 

### Displaying Top Defenses Breakdown

The Top Defenses section displays a breakdown of the top defenses by app, OS, and manufacturer.

[![Threatscope Defenses By](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/ThreatScope_Defenses_By.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/ThreatScope_Defenses_By.png)

**What can be inferred from the data?**

The data displayed in this section allows for the generation of a list of the characteristics of the apps and devices that are most targeted by the attacks.

Hover over a graph line in any of the **Top Defenses Breakdown** tiles to display the following breakdown:

* **App/OS/Device**  
  List the top attack’s identifier.
* **Total Detected/Protected**  
  The value of this field represents the number of attacks and threats associated with the performance stream being hovered in the date range listed in the **Date** field.  
  This field name is **Total Protected** when the trend line relates to performance streams in which Appdome blocked the attack; otherwise, the name is **Total Detected**.
* **Defense Mode**  
  See description in section Viewing all attacks.
* **Threat Event**  
  See description in section Viewing all attacks.

[![Threatscope Defenses By Tooltips](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/ThreatScope_Defenses_By_tooltips.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/ThreatScope_Defenses_By_tooltips.png)

### Attacks Breakdown

The Attacks Breakdown displays the attacks divided by Threat type:

* [ONEShield™ by Appdome](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/mobile-app-security/mobile-rasp-security/oneshield-no-code-mobile-rasp-explained/)
* [Mobile App Security](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/mobile-app-security/)
* [Mobile Fraud Detection](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/mobile-fraud-prevention-detection/)
* [Social Engineering Prevention](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/account-takeover-prevention/social-engineering-prevention/)
* [Malware Prevention](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/mobile-malware-prevention/)
* [Cheat Prevention](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/mobile-cheat-prevention/)
* [Geo Compliance](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/account-takeover-prevention/geo-compliance/)
* [Anti ATO](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/account-takeover-prevention/)
* [BOT™ Defense](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/mobile-bot-detection/)

The default view, as shown below, displays the group with the most events. You can change the display by clicking on any of the other doughnut graphs to display the data breakdown for that group:

[![Threatscope Attack Breakdown](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/ThreatScope_Attack_breakdown.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/ThreatScope_Attack_breakdown.png)

### **Mobile Risk Index™ (MRI)**

The **Mobile Risk Index™** provides the average mobile risk score for the selected app(s); when a single app is selected, it displays that app’s specific MRI metrics.

When hovering over each Threat Type graph, the tooltip displays the MRI details—showing overall risk for the full Appdome Protection Package at the top and threat-specific data in the detailed view below.

* **Infection Rate** – Measures the infection rate by dividing the number of threats by the total number of installations.
* **Frequency** – Tracks the average number of attack events per app session and measures the net change in the last measurement period.
* **Velocity** – Measures daily changes in infection rate and attack frequency, showing whether threats are increasing or decreasing compared to the previous day.

[![Threatscope Attack Breakdown Tooltips](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/ThreatScope_Attack_breakdown_tooltips.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/ThreatScope_Attack_breakdown_tooltips.png)

### Expanding the Attacks Breakdown

To view the detailed display for all attack types, click on the ‘Expand’ button at the top right corner to expand the display of all Event types. ![Expand](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Expand.png)

Collapse the display back to default mode by clicking on ‘Collapse.’ ![Collapse](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/collapse.png)

[![Threatscope Attack Breakdown Expanded](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/ThreatScope_Attack_Breakdown_Expanded.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/ThreatScope_Attack_Breakdown_Expanded.png)

## Filtering Threat Intelligence

### Standard Views

The **Standard Views** menu on the left side panel enables easy filtering and creation of custom views for the Threat Scope data.

[![Standard Views Panel](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Standard-Views-Panel.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Standard-Views-Panel.png)

**1. Select the data display option – Either by Event Instances or Impacted Devices.**

[![Standard Views Options](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Standard_Views_options.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Standard_Views_options.png)

**2. Select the Data displayed from one of the following categories**

[![All Attacks Button](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/All_Attacks_Button.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/All_Attacks_Button.png)  
**All Attacks –** Displays all accumulated data by the number of individual events. If a specific device experiences several events of the same type, all events will be counted.

[![App Defense Button](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/App_Defense_Button.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/App_Defense_Button.png) **App Defense –**Displays all Appdome detections whether or not they are enforced on the client app or sent to the client app via Threat Events.

[![Bot Defense Button](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Bot_Defense_Button.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Bot_Defense_Button.png)

**Bot Defense Data**—Access complete payload data from Appdome’s MobileBOT™ Defense (MBD) solution for insights on mobile infrastructure. Correlating and validating real attacks can detect and prevent attacks like credential stuffing and DDoS.

[![Build2test Events Button](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Build2Test_Events_Button.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Build2Test_Events_Button.png)

**Build2Test Events—This function summarizes** the Threat Events data only for apps built with the Build-to-Test feature. These apps are built specifically for testing via third-party vendors.  
[Learn more about Appdome’s Build-to-Test](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/devsecops-automation-mobile-cicd/test-secured-mobile-apps/use-appdomes-build-to-test-service/)

**2. Filter the data**

You can filter the data using any of the following filters and combine them to create unique views, gaining deeper insights into the events your Appdome-built apps are facing.

[![Filters](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Filters.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Filters.png)

The filters that can be used for controlling the displayed data are:

* **By Threats**
  + **Performance By** – The type of defense implemented in Threat Events.
  + **Event Type** – The Type of Event that was triggered (By Appdome’s defense categories)
* **By Apps**
  + **Task ID** – The unique ID of the task (upload/build/context/sign)
  + **App ID** – The unique ID of the app.
  + **Bundle ID** – The app’s identifier is listed in the **AndroidManifest.xml** or **Info.plist** file.
  + **Bundle Version** – The app’s version number.
* **By Build**
  + **Team Type**
  + **Account Name** – The Name of the account owner.
  + **Fusion Set Name** – The name of the fusion set to which the protected app is subscribed.
  + **Fusion Set ID** – The ID of the fusion set to which the protected app is subscribed.
* **By Platform**
  + **Manufacturer** – The device manufacturer associated with the detected attack.
  + **OS** – The platform related to the detected attack.
  + **OS Version** – The OS Version associated with the detected attack
  + **Country** – A specific Geo Source.

**3. Create View**

When the data is filtered, you can save it by creating a view.

[![Create View Left Panel](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Create_View_Left_Panel.png)](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Create_View_Left_Panel.png)

You can access your custom views via the main drop-down menu.

![Threatscope Drop Down Menu See Custom Views](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/ThreatScope-Drop-down-menu-see-custom-views-1.png)

[Learn more about Threat Inspect.](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/advanced-threat-intelligence-android-ios/threatscope-mobile-xdr/threatscope-mobile-xdr-using-threat-inspect/)

### Filtering by Specific Builds

![Filterbyspecificbuilds](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/FilterBySpecificBuilds.png)

The section View Specific Builds with Threats Only allows:

* A filter is applied to the ThreatScope by using specific builds of protected apps.
* The viewer can find a specific build using the search bar by looking for any of the attributes shown below. The tile filter is synchronized with the filter pane. For further information, see the **Filter Pane section**.
* Scrolling through the list of protected apps associated with the attacks & threats shown in the dashboard. The Build ID of the danger can be copied by clicking on the copy icon ![Copyiconupdated](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/CopyIconUpdated.png);

### Troubleshooting Access to ThreatScope Dashboard

This section provides troubleshooting information for resolving the following issues:

* Lack of the **View ThreatScope** entitlement.
* The viewer is a member of a team but does not have the **View ThreatScope** entitlement.
* The viewer is not a member of any team.
* The viewer or **View** **ThreatScope** entitlement was removed.
* If the viewer was a member of a team or had view entitlements, then the viewer was removed from the team or the view entitlement was removed.

### Lack of the **View ThreatScope** entitlement

![No Entitled Team Threatscope](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/no-entitled-team-threatscope-3.png)

**Cause:**

The viewer attempted to access the ThreatScope dashboard, but while the viewer’s account is a member of at least one team, that team does not have **View ThreatScope** entitlement permissions.

**Remediation:**

Add the **View ThreatScope** entitlement to each team to give the viewer access to threat data. For additional information, see the section on **Setting up access to ThreatScope Dashboard**.

### Viewer is not a member of any team

![No Team Workspace Used Threatscope](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/no-team-workspace-used-threatscope-1.png)

**Cause:**

The viewer tried to access the ThreatScope dashboard by using the All My Teams workspace, but the viewer’s account is not a member of any team.

**Remediation:**

Request the production team leader to invite the viewer’s account to join the team and add the **View ThreatScope** entitlement to each team so that the viewer can access the threat data. For further information, see the section **Setting up access to the ThreatScope Dashboard**.

### A viewer or **View** **ThreatScope**entitlement was removed

**![Forbidden Pop Up Threatscope](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/forbidden-pop-up-threatscope-1.png)**

**Cause:**

The viewer tried to access a team in the ThreatScope dashboard; however, the viewer’s account was removed from that team, or the **View ThreatScope** entitlement was removed from the viewer’s account in that team.

**Remediation:**

Request the production team leader to invite the viewer’s account to join the team and add the **View ThreatScope** entitlement to each team so that the viewer can access the threat data. For further information, see the section **Setting up access to ThreatScope Dashboard**.
